body.name: BreathableBaby Breathable Mesh Liner for Full-Size Cribs, Classic 3mm Mesh, Starlight (Size 4FS Covers 3 or 4 Sides)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 11 hrs 55 mins
features: 3MM CLASSIC MESH WITH 85% LIGHT BLOCKING RATING: Constructed from 3 mm mesh with A.C.T. Air Channel Technology for unrestricted airflow. 100% polyester. 1" (2.54 cm) trim on top and bottom. Machine washable.

FITS FULL-SIZE STYLES WITH A 52" x 28" (132 CM x 71 CM) MATTRESS: Install long 11" x 111" (28 cm x 282 cm) and short 11" x 82" (28 cm x 208 cm) panels to cover 4 sides or only the long panel to cover 3 sides. Do not use on solid end styles or mini cribs.

SAFETY TESTED & TRUSTED: From BreathableBaby, the original breathable mesh liner with millions sold since 2002. Independently tested for safety to comply with ASTM F1917 for infant bedding. Contains no added chemicals, flame retardants or formaldehyde.

HELPS KEEP ARMS AND LEGS SAFELY INSIDE WITHOUT THE RISK OF RESTRICTED AIRFLOW: A single layer of breathable mesh allows exhaled air to pass through the fabric and mitigates risks associated with padded "crib bumpers" (banned in the US in 2022).

EASY TO INSTALL: Adjusts to fit with hook and loop. Tuck the bottom fabric trim below the top edge of the mattress and secure all fastenings before use. Review instruction manual and installation video or contact customer care for assistance.
body.description: At BreathableBaby, safety is first, last, and everything in between. That's why we have invested countless hours into medical and scientific research to make our products safer. We invented and perfected the breathable mesh liner. The original breathable mesh liner with millions sold since 2002.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2010
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this product! Best alternative i've seen.
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoy this product. Had it for over 6 months and baby is 1 now. I used the standard cushy bumper while Jacob was small but as he began to roll around and toss and turn in his sleep he would snuggle up against the bumper. After coming in to find him with his nose in the bumper I removed it. Followed by waking up 4 times a night to retrieve his pacifier I decided we needed something else. I saw this product in a magazine and rushed to amazon to find it. I ended up getting the brown after switching back and forth from the blue (the rest of his bedding is navy, light blue, tan, and brown) and I think it looks good on our dark cherry colored crib. I have a drop side crib so the separate pieces work well (especially because when Jake attempts to climb I have to readjust usually just that side. Although there are gaps where the long side ends and the short side begins, I was so glad the pacifiers had a better chance of staying in. I did made one adjustment, the longest side is wrapped around the end posts instead of the slats because the gaps are too big the other way luckily the long end is long enough to make it all the way and it does not interfere with the drop side usage. now there is just a small gap on the front side that is rarely a problem. You will have to occasionally fish a pacifier out from in between the mesh and the mattress in between the slats (if that makes sense.) I find 1 to 2 surprise pacifiers when i lift the mattress on washing day. You can also make the Velcro as tight as you want it... tighter means it is less likely to collapse down as easily, but can make it easier for a climber to get a lift. looser will make it hard to climb, but the looser fabric can decrease the breath ability if it gets squished down early in the sleeping cycle. Overall, i love this product because it does keep the pacifier in and is breathable and collapsible also the Velcro is very strong. I have washed it 3 or 4 times and it holds up nicely but tends to grab lint, so i recommend washing it with sheets only and no blankets... not a big deal. If you don't have a drop-side crib i recommend putting the short side in the back instead of the front and wrap around the end posts in the back. this will make the gaps less noticeable, but will also create room for pacifiers to fall in a harder to reach area by the wall.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: So my babies crib went up and within 5 minutes had her leg stuck and crying, soon after her hand. Item was received the next day and installed and problem fix. Easy install and the stars are a cute decorative feature.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to install, high quality fabric, my only complaint (and the reason it got 4 stars) is there is really no way to keep it from scrunching down on the crib. We have to adjust it constantly. Otherwise, works great, baby loves it when he's trying to fall asleep, and it keeps his feet from sliding out between the slats and getting caught. Worth it for peace of mind.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy installation, works like a charm
reviews.reviewText: We initially had our baby crib barren of everything but the fitted sheet (first time parents, very worried about safe sleep) and quickly learned that as soon as our baby started rolling we needed SOMETHING to stop her from getting her arm dangerously caught in the railing. We had this expedited to our home and it was an easy set up. We've had it for a few months now and it's been easy to readjust it as her crib needs changed. It's lightly padded (or kinda cushy) so if the baby rolls and sleeps against the edge im not worried about her being uncomfortable. As the baby has gotten more bold with climbing and crawling she can push this down and pull on it, but typically it poops back up to its original position.Overall I would recommend this to anyone with a baby, even if you use it just for those early months.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Fit our crib perfectly and looks great! Soft fabric, which is good since my baby loves to smoosh herself against the walls of the crib. We had an issue at first and contacted their support team and it was resolved in one day so I have faith in the company if there is a problem. Would recommend

reviews.reviewText: Muy bonito pero si la cuna no es de barandal no funciona, porque no se puede detener en superficie plana

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Breathable, secure, functional, high quality and cute!

reviews.reviewTitle: Suave, respirable y de buena calidad.
reviews.reviewText: Muy buena calidad. Suave para reducir los golpes y las manitas entre los barrotes de la cuna pero respirable para reducir el riesgo de sofocación. Buen acabado. Lo recomiendo.Ponerlo fue un poco complejo pero hay que leer las instrucciones con cuidado para que quede bien.
El producto llegó a tiempo se lo compre a mi nieta
Es gruesa, transpirable, justo como la necesitaba para la cuna que no estorbara, que si cubriera bien los bordes de la cuna.En general, está de muy buena calidad.

Nos ha servido muy bien. Nuestra bebé siempre se quedaba atascada entre las rejas de su cuna y ya no podía salir sola. Con esto se resolvió ese problema. Deja pasar el aire, entonces no hay peligro de asfixiarse. Cabe mencionar que la descripción del producto menciona que sólo se debe usar hasta que gatea el bebé.
Buen producto, cumple con lo esperado.
